basis

Class TCPClientCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • basis.TCPClientCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FakeCommunicator

    public class TCPClientCommunicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Creates a new TCP client. This class is responsible for the communication between the server and the client. When the client needs the server to execute a specific command, it should create a JSON message which respects the protocol specification and give the required elements for the execution of the command.
    Author:
    Nicolas
    See Also:
    Documentation/protocol/

      The bot the client is logged in as.
      private java.lang.Thread clientThread
      The client thread is the thread in charge of listening client messages.
      private boolean closed
      Whether the listening thread is closed.
      private DBManager dbm
      The database manager that enables the communicator to retrieve and update data in the database.
      private TCPClientHandler handler
      The client handler used to call back the server when specific events occur.
      private static org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER 
      private boolean muted
      Whether the client is muted.
      private java.net.Socket socket
      The socket used to communicate with the client.

      TCPClientCommunicator(java.net.Socket socket)
      Creates a new TCP client communicator without handler.
      TCPClientCommunicator(java.net.Socket socket, TCPClientHandler handler)
      Creates a new TCP client communicator.

    • Field Detail

      • LOGGER

        private static final org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER

      • socket

        private java.net.Socket socket
        The socket used to communicate with the client. Should be set only once, when you call the constructor.
        See Also:
        Socket

      • __reader__

        private java.io.BufferedReader __reader__
        The buffered reader used to read text-formatted messages from the client's socket input stream. It is created and cached during initialization to avoid creating a new BufferedReader every time we have to read a message from the client.
        See Also:
        BufferedReader

      • __writer__

        private java.io.PrintWriter __writer__
        The print writer used to print text-formatted messages on the client's socket output stream. It is created and cached during initialization to avoid creating a new PrintWriter every time we have to send a message to the client.
        See Also:
        PrintWriter

      • bot

        protected Bot bot
        The bot the client is logged in as. Is null when the client is not logged in as a bot yet.

      • dbm

        private DBManager dbm
        The database manager that enables the communicator to retrieve and update data in the database.

      • handler

        private TCPClientHandler handler
        The client handler used to call back the server when specific events occur.

      • clientThread

        private java.lang.Thread clientThread
        The client thread is the thread in charge of listening client messages. Create a new thread enables us to listen to multiple client at the same time. The client communicator is autonomous because it runs its own thread.
        See Also:
        Thread

      • muted

        private boolean muted
        Whether the client is muted. A muted client can still send messages, but those messages are queued because the communicator no longer read those.

      • closed

        private boolean closed
        Whether the listening thread is closed. Turning this boolean to true will stop the listening thread from running.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClientCommunicator

        public TCPClientCommunicator(java.net.Socket socket)
        Creates a new TCP client communicator without handler.
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket of the TCP client.

      • TCPClientCommunicator

        public TCPClientCommunicator(java.net.Socket socket,
                             TCPClientHandler handler)
        Creates a new TCP client communicator.
        Parameters:
        socket - the socket of the TCP client.
        handler - the client handler used to notify the server a client was created.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the mechanics of a TCP client communicator which is to read input messages from the client. When a message is read, the communicator handles it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • receive

        private void receive(org.json.JSONObject msgObj)
              throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a client request.
        Parameters:
        msgObj - the JSON message containing the request.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/

      • receiveGameActions

        private void receiveGameActions(org.json.JSONObject content)
                         throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "gameactions" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "gameactions" message, depends on the type of game implemented.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gameactions.html

      • receiveLogin

        private void receiveLogin(org.json.JSONObject content)
                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "login" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "login" message, should only contains the token generated for the bot.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/login.html

      • receiveLogout

        private void receiveLogout(org.json.JSONObject content)
                    throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "logout" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "logout" message (it should be void in this type of message.)
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/logout.html

      • receiveSetMode

        private void receiveSetMode(org.json.JSONObject content)
                     throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "setmode" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "setmode" message, should contains the desired mode.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/setmode.html

      • receiveToken

        private void receiveToken(org.json.JSONObject content)
                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "token" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "token" message, should contains the desired nickname for the bot to create.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/token.html

      • receiveKillBot

        private void receiveKillBot(org.json.JSONObject content)
                     throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "killbot" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "killbot" message, should contains the token of the bot to remove.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/killbot.html

      • receiveRanking

        private void receiveRanking(org.json.JSONObject content)
                     throws org.json.JSONException
        Receives a "ranking" client request and then sends back to the client a report describing the operation(s) performed or the failure of the request and the reason of the failure.
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the "ranking" message, should contains the list of bots ordered by score in a descending order.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - if the content is not correctly formed.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/ranking.html

      • send

        private void send(java.lang.String type,
                  int error,
                  java.lang.String message,
                  org.json.JSONObject content)
        Sends a message to the TCP client. Messages are formatted in JSON.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of message.
        error - the error id (0 if no error.)
        message - a legible string describing the message.
        content - the content of the message, depends on the type of message.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/

      • sendGameState

        public void sendGameState(org.json.JSONObject content)
        Sends a "gamestate" message to the client. The client is supposed to return its actions within a specific time interval.
        Parameters:
        content - the object representing the current game state.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamestate.html

      • sendGameStart

        public void sendGameStart(org.json.JSONObject content)
        Sends a "gamestart" message to the client indicating that a game just started for him.
        Parameters:
        content - the object representing the initial game state.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamestart.html

      • sendGameEnd

        public void sendGameEnd(org.json.JSONObject content)
        Sends a "gameend" message to the client indicating that the game just ended.
        Parameters:
        content - the object representing the ending game state and replay data.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gameend.html

      • sendGameMute

        public void sendGameMute(org.json.JSONObject content)
        Sends a "gamemute" message to the client indicating that its bot was muted for this game and hence, can no longer send "gameactions" message until it receives a new "gamestate" message.
        Parameters:
        content - the object giving the reason(s) and additional information(s) about the mute.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gamemute.html

      • sendWelcome

        public void sendWelcome()
        Sends a "welcome" message to the client. The client is not supposed to respond.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/welcome.html

      • sendBye

        public void sendBye(java.lang.String reason)
        Sends a "bye" message to the client. The client is not supposed to respond.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason of the closing.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/bye.html

      • logout

        private void logout()
        Attempts to properly logout the bot of the client from the server and notifies the server of this event. Nothing happens if the client is not logged in as a bot. This method is a shortcut for the closing methods which require a proper logout.

      • _close

        private void _close()
        Closes the communicator of a client. The server will no longer listen to this client. If the client is logged in with a bot, it will be logged out.

      • close

        public void close(java.lang.String reason)
        Closes the communicator of a client. The server will no longer listen to this client. If the client is logged in with a bot, it will be logged out.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason of the closing.

      • isValidNickname

        private boolean isValidNickname(java.lang.String nick)
        Tests whether a nickname is valid according to the nickname specifications.
        Parameters:
        nick - the desired nickname for a bot.
        Returns:
        true if the nickname is valid, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/nickspecs.html

      • isBotLoggedIn

        public boolean isBotLoggedIn()
        Returns whether the client is logged in with a bot.
        Returns:
        true if the client is logged in, false otherwise

      • getBot

        public Bot getBot()
        Gets the bot of the client.
        Returns:
        the bot of the client.

      • mute

        public void mute()
        Mutes a client. A muted client can still send messages, but the server no longer read those.

      • unmute

        public void unmute()
        Unmutes a client. As messages sent by a muted client are queued, all messages sent by the client while it was muted will be read the by communicator.
